paragraphs.text: Personally, I don’t that I will be laying on my deathbed, proud that I lived a practical life.
paragraphs.name: 83d5

paragraphs.text: Hobbies come and go. Purpose does not.
paragraphs.name: 9da0

paragraphs.text: You must start choosing what inputs you allow in your life. You must be the curator of your newsfeed. Be strict about what and who you let into your life. Be okay with being selfish. You need to realize your own greatness before you can really help others.
paragraphs.name: dbb9

paragraphs.text: You must start choosing what inputs you allow in your life. You must be the curator of your newsfeed. Be strict about what and who you let into your life. Be okay with being selfish. You need to realize your own greatness before you can really help others.
paragraphs.name: dbb9

paragraphs.text: It’s time…
paragraphs.name: ad34

paragraphs.text: Benjamin, Thank you so much. Finding purpose of life such complex task for everyone. Some of us find it and most of us don’t. But, they way you explained about finding purpose of life is quite excellent, in a very simple manner. I am looking forward for more such articles.
paragraphs.name: 299a

d908bb9e1e81.title: A Little Story About A Rabbit That Will Teach You About Life

paragraphs.text: A Little Story About A Rabbit That Will Teach You About Life
paragraphs.name: b3af

content.subtitle: Once upon a time, there was a rabbit.

virtuals.subtitle: Once upon a time, there was a rabbit.

paragraphs.text: Thanks for sharing this Benjamin. Your post encompasses my thoughts and dreams too! I never want to live a life of mediocrity and lack of passion but I will chase my dreams and work to find, internalise and realise my goals to the best of my ability and I will not be afraid or shy to ask for help along the way. Thanks again Benjamin!
paragraphs.name: 8c68

34d8dc3a64dc.title: Most rabbits I have known have primarily been engaged in the business of converting grass into poop

paragraphs.text: Most rabbits I have known have primarily been engaged in the business of converting grass into poop
paragraphs.name: b608

157d9c2c4007.title: The simple yet powerful way to separate purpose from hobbies. Wow.

paragraphs.text: The simple yet powerful way to separate purpose from hobbies. Wow.
paragraphs.name: 5e2d

e00e900d53bb.title: Thank you for this. I needed to hear this.

paragraphs.text: Thank you for this. I needed to hear this.
paragraphs.name: 4c27

f78846bf154a.title: I agree. And it is sooooo critical!

paragraphs.text: I agree. And it is sooooo critical!
Thanks Georgiana!
paragraphs.name: b5eb

ab3c5f659f09.title: It’s surprising to me how many people don’t understand how important this is.

paragraphs.text: It’s surprising to me how many people don’t understand how important this is. You are the people you surround yourself with, the news you ingest, the entertainment you like best, the decor of your room…everything plays a part.
paragraphs.name: f4d3

21ba2990ba07.title: Thanks, Benjamin, for putting so succinctly something I learned many years ago in “What Color is…

paragraphs.text: Thanks, Benjamin, for putting so succinctly something I learned many years ago in “What Color is Your Parachute”. That book helped me look at my many life experiences and distill out what was really important to me. In my case, learning, writing, and explaining (or teaching). I can’t say I’ve ever fulfilled my ambitions perfectly — or even adequately…
paragraphs.name: 705b

content.subtitle: What was new to me (and equally important) was the concept of “choosing your inputs”. Good food for thought. Thanks again.

virtuals.subtitle: What was new to me (and equally important) was the concept of “choosing your inputs”. Good food for thought. Thanks again.

paragraphs.text: Simplicity…..
paragraphs.name: fb5a

paragraphs.text: …is power!

3f150b892ae9.title: I applaud you! Now keep going and don’t let anything stop you.

paragraphs.text: I applaud you! Now keep going and don’t let anything stop you.

f43682f69445.title: I like the part where you say ‘Purpose will pop up its head again…’ that’s so refreshing, sometimes…

paragraphs.text: I like the part where you say ‘Purpose will pop up its head again…’ that’s so refreshing, sometimes we think we’ve lost our purpose due to circumstances around us but it’s indeed the voices and opinions that are flooding us, we need an outlet to reduce the floods so that purpose can reign supreme….thanks for sharing this Benjamin
paragraphs.name: c062

e731317ea8a7.title: Thanks for your kind words, Ajas.

paragraphs.text: Thanks for your kind words, Ajas. Purpose is usually dressed up like work and first looks like curiosity. It doesn’t become a purpose until you chase it with everything you have
paragraphs.name: 7d43

paragraphs.text: “I don’t think that” ?
